title: Simplify sidebar navigation labels
description:
# Simplify Sidebar Navigation Labels **Goal:** Remove redundant section labels and rename Settings to Calendar. **Architecture:** Update both Sidebar and MobileMenu components to remove the "Menu" and "Settings" section labels, and rename the "Settings" nav item to "Calendar" with a calendar icon. **Tech Stack:** SvelteKit, Svelte 5 --- ## Problem 1. "Menu" section label is redundant - the items are self-explanatory 2. "Settings" section label is redundant - there's only one item 3. "Settings" is misleading - the page only handles calendar connections ## Files - Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/dashboard/Sidebar.svelte` - Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/dashboard/MobileMenu.svelte` ## Changes ### Sidebar.svelte **Step 1: Update settingsItems to rename Settings to Calendar (line 21-23)** From: ```typescript const settingsItems: NavItem[] = [ { href: '/settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings' } ] ``` To: ```typescript const settingsItems: NavItem[] = [ { href: '/settings', label: 'Calendar', icon: 'calendar' } ] ``` **Step 2: Remove "Menu" label (line 70)** Delete: ```html
Menu
``` **Step 3: Remove "Settings" label (line 93)** Delete: ```html
Settings
``` **Step 4: Update icon conditional to handle 'calendar' icon (around line 96)** Change from settings icon to calendar icon: ```svelte {:else if item.icon === 'calendar'} {/if} ``` ### MobileMenu.svelte **Step 1: Update navItems to rename Settings to Calendar (line 19)** From: ```typescript { href: '/settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings' } ``` To: ```typescript { href: '/settings', label: 'Calendar', icon: 'calendar' } ``` **Step 2: Remove "Menu" label (line 98)** Delete: ```html
Menu
``` **Step 3: Update icon conditional (around line 130-139)** Change from settings icon to calendar icon: ```svelte {:else if item.icon === 'calendar'} {/if} ``` ## Verification 1. Run `cd frontend && pnpm check` - should pass 2. Navigate to dashboard 3. Sidebar should show: Dashboard, Booking Links, Polls, Calendar (no section labels) 4. Click Calendar - should navigate to /settings page 5. Test on mobile - MobileMenu should match ## Commit ```bash git add frontend/src/lib/components/dashboard/Sidebar.svelte frontend/src/lib/components/dashboard/MobileMenu.svelte git commit -m "refactor: simplify sidebar nav, rename Settings to Calendar" ```

title: Dashboard Redesign: Neo-Brutalist Theme
description:
Redesign the Meet Mesh frontend dashboard to match the prototype at frontend/static/prototype-dashboard.html. 

## Goal
Transform the current dashboard from a soft, modern design to a neo-brutalist aesthetic with light/dark mode support, offset shadows, solid borders, and vibrant accent colors.

## Key Features
- Neo-brutalist design: offset shadows, solid 2px borders, 8px radius
- Light/dark mode with glowing accent effects in dark mode
- Sidebar with logo icon, grouped nav, badges, user card
- Stats grid with colored icons and trend badges
- Booking list with status dots and icon action buttons
- Quick actions panel
- Mini calendar widget
- Activity feed
- Outfit font family

## Architecture
- Update CSS variables in app.css for neo-brutalist tokens
- Modify existing UI components (Card, Button, Badge) for new aesthetic
- Update dashboard components (Sidebar, StatsCard, BookingRow, etc.)
- Add new components (ThemeToggle, IconButton, QuickActions, MiniCalendar, ActivityFeed)
- Update dashboard page layout with two-column content grid

## Tech Stack
- SvelteKit with Svelte 5 runes
- Tailwind CSS v4
- Google Fonts (Outfit)

title: Switch Outfit font from Google Fonts to Fontsource
description:
Replace the Google Fonts CDN link for Outfit with a self-hosted Fontsource package for better privacy, performance, and offline support.

## Current Implementation
- Google Fonts link in `frontend/src/app.html`
- Font loaded via CDN at runtime

## Target Implementation
- Install `@fontsource-variable/outfit` package
- Import font in SvelteKit layout
- Update CSS font-family to `'Outfit Variable', sans-serif`
- Remove Google Fonts `<link>` tags from app.html

## Steps
1. Run `pnpm add @fontsource-variable/outfit` in frontend/
2. Add `import '@fontsource-variable/outfit';` to `frontend/src/routes/+layout.svelte`
3. Update `font-family` in `frontend/src/app.css` to use `'Outfit Variable'`
4. Remove the Google Fonts preconnect and stylesheet links from `frontend/src/app.html`
5. Test that fonts render correctly in dev mode

## Benefits
- No external network requests for fonts
- Better privacy (no Google tracking)
- Faster loading (bundled with app)
- Works offline

title: Neo-brutalist UI polish and dark mode fixes
description:

11. Vote buttons and public pages dark mode

title: Fix broken link icon SVG
description:
## Problem
The link icon appears broken (shows incomplete curved line) in:
- Sidebar "Booking Links" nav item
- "New Link" button in dashboard header
- "Booking Links" stats card on dashboard

## Files
- Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/dashboard/Sidebar.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/routes/(dashboard)/+page.svelte`

## Root Cause
The SVG path for the link icon is incomplete. It only has one half of the chain link.

## Fix
Replace the broken link SVG with the complete chain link icon:
```html
<svg fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24">
  <path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M13.828 10.172a4 4 0 00-5.656 0l-4 4a4 4 0 105.656 5.656l1.102-1.101m-.758-4.899a4 4 0 005.656 0l4-4a4 4 0 00-5.656-5.656l-1.1 1.1"/>
</svg>
```

## Verification
- Navigate to dashboard
- Check sidebar "Booking Links" shows complete link icon
- Check "New Link" button shows complete link icon
- Check "Booking Links" stats card shows complete link icon

title: Fix SPA navigation after creating booking link or poll
description:
## Problem
After creating a new booking link or poll, the page does a hard refresh instead of SPA navigation. This causes:
- Loss of dark mode state (if not persisted)
- Full page reload flash
- Poor user experience

## Files
- Modify: `frontend/src/routes/(dashboard)/booking-links/new/+page.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/routes/(dashboard)/polls/new/+page.svelte`

## Root Cause
The form submission likely uses native form action or window.location instead of SvelteKit's goto().

## Fix
After successful API call, use SvelteKit navigation:
```typescript
import { goto } from '$app/navigation';

// After successful creation:
await goto('/booking-links');
// or
await goto('/polls');
```

Ensure no `window.location.href` or form action redirects are used.

## Verification
- Create a new booking link
- Page should navigate smoothly without full reload
- Dark mode state should be preserved
- Create a new poll
- Same smooth navigation behavior

title: Add dark mode support to Input component
description:
## Problem

- `text-gray-900` text
- `focus:ring-indigo-500` focus ring

## Files
- Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/ui/Input.svelte`

## Fix
Replace Tailwind color classes with CSS variable equivalents:
- Background: `bg-[var(--bg-secondary)]`
- Border: `border-[var(--border-color)]`
- Text: `text-[var(--text-primary)]`
- Placeholder: `placeholder:text-[var(--text-muted)]`
- Focus ring: `focus:ring-[var(--sky)]`
- Label: `text-[var(--text-secondary)]`

Also add neo-brutalist styling:
- Border width: 2px
- Border radius: `var(--radius)`

## Verification

- Labels should be readable

title: Fix dark mode text readability across pages
description:
## Problem
Multiple components have unreadable text in dark mode due to hardcoded colors:
- Booking/poll card titles (e.g., "Quick Call") 
- VoteCard date titles ("Saturday, January 31")
- Form section labels ("Your Information", "Custom Fields")
- BookingPage step descriptions

## Files
- Modify: `frontend/src/routes/(dashboard)/booking-links/+page.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/routes/(dashboard)/polls/+page.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/poll/VoteCard.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/poll/VoterForm.svelte`
- Modify: `frontend/src/lib/components/booking/BookingPage.svelte`

## Fix
Replace hardcoded text colors with CSS variables:
- Titles: `text-[var(--text-primary)]` (was `text-gray-900`)
- Subtitles/labels: `text-[var(--text-secondary)]` (was `text-gray-600`)
- Muted text: `text-[var(--text-muted)]` (was `text-gray-400/500`)
- Borders: `border-[var(--border-color)]` (was `border-gray-200`)

## Verification
- Toggle dark mode
- Navigate to booking-links list - card title readable
- Navigate to polls list - card title readable
- Navigate to public poll page - date titles readable
- Navigate to public booking page - step text readable
